perturbation.original_text: The term "Effective Date" shall mean the latest of (a) the date of the last signature of this Agreement, or (b) if a HSR filing is made, the second Business Day immediately following the earlier of: (i) the date upon which the waiting period under HSR expires or terminates early or (ii) the date upon which all requests to the Parties by the Federal Trade Commission or the Justice Department, as the case may be, with regard to the transaction contemplated by this Agreement
perturbation.changed_text: The term "Effective Date" shall mean the latest of (a) the date of the last signature of this Agreement, or (b) if a HSR filing is made, the fifth Business Day immediately following the earlier of: (i) the date upon which the waiting period under HSR expires or terminates early or (ii) the date upon which all requests to the Parties by the Federal Trade Commission or the Justice Department, as the case may be, with regard to the transaction contemplated by this Agreement
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Effective Date' is modified to create a contradiction. By changing 'second' to 'fifth,' the agreement now specifies two different ways to determine the start date, which may result in uncertainty regarding when the agreement officially comes into effect and, therefore, when the obligations of the parties commence.

perturbation.original_text:
1.36 FTE

The term "FTE" shall mean a full-time equivalent person-year, based upon a total of no less than one thousand eight hundred (1,800) working hours per year, undertaken in connection with the conduct of research in a Work Stream. In no circumstance can the work of any given person exceed one (1) FTE.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.36 Personnel

The term "Personnel" shall mean a full-time equivalent person-year, based upon a total of no less than one thousand nine hundred (1,900) working hours per year, undertaken in connection with the conduct of research in a Work Stream. In no circumstance can the work of any given person exceed one (1) Personnel.
perturbation.explanation: The term "FTE" is changed to "Personnel" and the number of working hours changed from 'one thousand eight hundred' to 'one thousand nine hundred'. This change can cause confusion because 'FTE Rate' is defined based on the term 'FTE' which now has an equivalent term, which can cause dispute in payments and HR.

perturbation.original_text: For Molecular Information Database Access and performance of Database Queries by FMI, Roche will pay FMI a total of […***…] of the Database Term, (the "Database Access Fee"), which is comprised of funding for […***…] FTEs, each at the FTE Rate, for performance of such Database Queries and delivery of Database Insights, and a Database Access Fee of […***…]. Roche shall pay to FMI the Database Access Fee […***…] installments of […***…], each payable every […***…] of the Database term and within […***…] after receipt by Roche of an invoice from FMI.
perturbation.changed_text: For Molecular Information Database Access and performance of Database Queries by FMI, Roche will provide FMI a total of […***…] of the Database Term, (the "Database Access Fee"), which is comprised of funding for […***…] Workers, each at the Worker Rate, for performance of such Database Queries and delivery of Database Insights, and a Database Access Fee of […***…]. Roche shall pay to FMI the Database Access Fee […***…] installments of […***…], each payable every […***…] of the Database term and within […***…] after receipt by Roche of an invoice from FMI.
perturbation.explanation: The term "FTEs" is changed to "Workers" and the number of 'FTE Rate' to 'Worker Rate'. If there is no definition to describe what the 'Worker Rate' is, this creates uncertainty in calculating the correct amount to be paid. This contradicts the payment term.
